Articles.Content:
Heat death of the universe?

Maybe a death of the universe, but not through entropy.

The Sun?

Nope.

Pulsar? Supernova?

Scarier than that.

A galaxy?

Even scarier than that as well.
Vacuum metastability event? Big Crunch? The Great Attractor?
The end of the universe?

The Great Attractor?

Bam. Your move.
I defer to someone else, it's too late here to come up with one.
Anyone willing to be the next riddle-maker?

Sure let me think of something, just a sec...

An Island he protected

Of scarlet he became great

Distinctive attire he wore and

the makes of thistle and three feat

could not match his make

Across a channel of fame

I also made my name

Like thieves I did my deeds

A protector I was too

Of infamy I am greater, for fame I came much too later

Who am I ?

Here's a hint, solve the first part, I'l tell you if you get it, then it should be really easy to solve the second part... Il also help if it gets too hard..

edit: editing one line for clarity

Edited June 29, 2015 by Nemrav
Robin Hood?
St. Patrick?
Henry?
Eric the Red?
nope... closest was RobotEngineer, both persons are fictional...
Saint Nicholas? AKA Santa Claus?
I can't do too much with old lore, so I might sit this one out...
King Arthur? Lancelot? Galahad? St. George?
Merlin?
You're all on the right track, but think of an era much closer to now than medieval (but still not contemporary)
Billy Blood?
Billy the Kid? Jesse James? Bonnie and Clive? (Clide?)
The first and second halves talk about two different people, try and go after the first one (the guy who is not like a thief)
Queen Elizabeth the First? Sorry, I'm not good at stuff.

Sorry guys, I've gtg from my internet for a while which means the game is up and whoever makes a riddle first is the winner, heres the riddle with commented notes on the clues, the answer to pt1 was Sherlock Holmes, and the second was meant to be the vigilante Arsene Lupin (though in some cases the clues would still fit Holmes)

An Island he protected -- solved crimes in G.B

Of scarlet he became great -- famous for "A study in Scarlet"

Distinctive attire he wore and

the makes of thistle and three feat -- thistle is the scotch plant (scotland), three feet makes a yard, so Scotland Yard

could not match his make -- Lestrade couldn't match Holmes

Across a channel of fame -- across the english channel

I also made my name -- Arsene Lupin is famous in France

Like thieves I did my deeds -- In addition to solving crimes, he commited his own, and was more mischievious

A protector I was too -- solved crimes

Of infamy I am greater, for fame I came much too later -- he came later than Holmes, and never became as famous as such

Who am I ?

"Who Am I"

Arsene Lupin!

(Please note that Flymetothemun is not responsible for any info leaks and merely uses them to his own advantage)
